API Reference¶

Application¶

class pytero.PteroApp(url: str, key: str)¶

A class/interface for interacting with the application API.

url: str

The URL of the Pterodactyl domain. This must be an absolute URL, not one that contains paths (trailing forward slash is allowed).

key: str

The API key to use for HTTP requests. This can be either an application API key or a Client API key (as of Pterodactyl v1.8).

@event¶

Returns the HTTP class event decorator for registering events to trigger on.

async create_user(*, email: str, username: str, first_name: str, last_name: str, password: Optional[str] = None, external_id: Optional[str] = None, root_admin: bool = False) → User¶

Creates a new user account with the given fields.

email: str

The email for the user.

username: str

The username for the user.

fist_name: str

The first name of the user.

last_name: str

The last name of the user.

password: Optional[str]

The password for the user (default is None).

external_id: Optional[str]

An external identifier for the user (default is None).

root_admin: Optional[bool]

Whether the user should be considered an admin (default is False).

async delete_user(id: int, /) → None¶

Deletes a user by its ID.

id: int

The ID of the user to delete.

async get_external_user(id: str, /) → User¶

Returns a user from the API with the given external identifier.

id: str

The external identifier of the user.

async get_user(id: int, *, include: Optional[list[str]] = None) → User¶

Returns a user from the API with the given ID.

id: int

The ID of the user.

include: Optional[list[str]]
A list of additional resources to include (default is None). This supports:

  • servers

async get_users(*, filter: Optional[tuple[str, str]] = None, include: Optional[list[str]] = None, sort: Optional[str] = None) → list[pytero.users.User]¶

Returns a list of users from the API with the given options if specified.

filter: Optional[tuple[str, str]]

A tuple containing the filter type and argument to filter by (default is None). This supports: * email * uuid * username * external_id

include: Optional[list[str]]

A list of additional resources to include (default is None). This supports: * servers

sort: Optional[str]

The order to sort the results in (default is None). This supports: * id * uuid

async update_user(id: int, *, email: Optional[str] = None, username: Optional[str] = None, first_name: Optional[str] = None, last_name: Optional[str] = None, password: Optional[str] = None, external_id: Optional[str] = None, root_admin: bool = False) → User¶

Updates a specified user with the given fields.

id: int

The ID of the user to update.

email: Optional[str]

The email for the user (default is the current value).

username: Optional[str]

The username for the user (default is the current value).

fist_name: Optional[str]

The first name of the user (default is the current value).

last_name: Optional[str]

The last name of the user (default is the current value).

password: Optional[str]

The password for the user (default is None).

external_id: Optional[str]

An external identifier for the user (default is the current value).

root_admin: Optional[bool]

Whether the user should be considered an admin (default is the current value).
